description: Registers a new task definition from the supplied family and containerDefinitions.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Registering a task definition can be leveraged to create scheduled tasks within ECS, allowing for persistence and automated execution of malicious tasks.
Task definitions could be used to download and execute additional tools or scripts from external sources
ECS tasks can be configured to disable or modify security tools within the container environment, aiding in defense evasion.
The task definitions can contain Unix shell commands, facilitating execution of malicious scripts or commands.
Malicious task definitions can be disguised as legitimate ones to evade detection and blend in with normal operations
Container definitions within ECS can include obfuscated or packed scripts and binaries, making detection harder.

securityImplications: Attackers might use RegisterTaskDefinition to deploy containers with malicious tasks in AWS ECS.
